summary:
**Meeting Overview**:  
The Economic Development Committee of the Dallas City Council will convene on February 3, 2025, at 1:00 PM. This meeting will take place in the Council Chambers on the 6th floor of City Hall and will also be accessible via videoconference. The primary purpose is to discuss economic development initiatives and upcoming agenda items.

**Key Agenda Items**:  
1. Approval of the minutes from the January 6, 2025, meeting.
2. Briefings on several upcoming agenda items scheduled for February 12 and 26, 2025, including:
   - FY 2023-2024 Tax Increment Financing (TIF) District Annual Reports.
   - New Markets Tax Credit Transaction for St. Philipâ€™s School and Community Center.
   - Amendment of economic development agreements with Shekinah Legacy Holdings, LLC for the MLK Redevelopment Project.
   - Construction Services Contract for the Trinity Strand Trail Hi-Line Span Project.

**Important Details**:  
The meeting will include discussions on the Small Business Microgrants Program and a quarterly update on economic development incentives awarded via administrative action. These items are crucial for supporting local businesses and enhancing community development.

**Action Items**:  
The committee will seek approval for the minutes from the previous meeting and will discuss the proposed agreements and contracts, aiming for recommendations to be forwarded to the full City Council for final approval. Additionally, an executive session may be held to discuss sensitive matters related to economic development negotiations and potential litigation.
